utterance: I thought Mrs. Smith was dead,
speaker: Polly's mother

utterance: She was buried alive and kern to!
speaker: Polly

utterance: Melican boy pleenty foolee ! Melican boy no  Pilat!
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Wotcher say?
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Melican boy's papa heap lickee him spose him  leal Pilat,
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Melican  boy Pilat inside housee ; Chinee boy Pilat outside  housee. First chop Pilat.
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Ah! Ho! Mutiny and  Splordinashun ! Way with him to the yard  arm.
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Yald aim heap foolee ! Allee same clothes  hoss for washee washee.
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Go to bed  instantly without your supper,
speaker: Polly

utterance: Really, I never saw such bad pirates Say your  prayers, and see that you're up early to church to morrow.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Me no shabbee Pilat zft&ifchousee; me shabbee  Pilat outside housee. Spose you lun away longside  Chinee boy Chinee boy makee you Pilat
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Wot !
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Mebbee you too frightened to lun away. Melican boy's papa heap lickee.
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Dy'ar think we daresent,
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: I'll show yer to-morrow.
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Did ye ever hear  the loikes uv that, Ma'am,
speaker: Bridget

utterance: Shure the darlint's head is filled noight and day with ancient history. She's  after asking me now if Queen's ever run away !
speaker: Bridget

utterance: Hallo, fellers.
speaker: Patsey

utterance: Hello!
speaker: The Pirates

utterance: Coin' to hunt bars ? Dad seed a lot o' tracks at sun up.
speaker: Patsey

utterance: No o
speaker: The Pirates

utterance: I am ; know where I kin get a six shooter.
speaker: Patsey

utterance: Can't 1  We've runn'd away for real pirates.
speaker: The Pirates

utterance: Not for good!
speaker: Patsey

utterance: Yes!
speaker: Polly

utterance: Can't go back again. Never! Never! Never! The the eye is cast!
speaker: Polly

utterance: No'o! Sho'o ! Wanter know.
speaker: Patsey

utterance: The Perleese is  on our track !
speaker: The Pirates

utterance: Lemme go with yer!
speaker: Patsey

utterance: Wot'll yer giv ?
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Pistol and er bananer.
speaker: Patsey

utterance: Lets see  em.
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Catchee tunnel - - heap  gold,
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: When manee come out side to catchee dinner Pilats go inside catchee  tunnel ! Shabbee ! Pilats catchee gold allee samee  Melican man !
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: And take perseshiun,
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: And hoist the Pirate flag,
speaker: Patsey

utterance: And build a fire, and cook, and have a family,
speaker: Polly

utterance: Its orful far off!
speaker: Patsey

utterance: Pap sez its free miles on  the road. Take all day ter get there.
speaker: Patsey

utterance: Less go down er slide !
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Hang on by your eyelids, Sis ! but don't stir  for Heaven's sake!
speaker: unspecified

utterance: Darned ef I ever want to cut off a Chinaman's  pig-tail again, boys,
speaker: unspecified

utterance: Mebbee a wicked Joss backside holee, He  catchee Pilats,
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Let's say our prayers and frighten it away,
speaker: Polly

utterance: No! No!
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: No frighten Spillits! You waitee! Chinee boy he  talkee Spillit not to frighten you.
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: He's made the Evil Spirit orful sick.
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: See, Evil Spillet be likee Chinee, try talkee him.
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Lady Mary's hair's gone!
speaker: Polly

utterance: Ha! ha! skelped by Injins!
speaker: Hickory Hunt

utterance: Lady Maley's pig-tail hangee top side hillee. Catchee on big quartz stone allee same Polly, me go fetchee.
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: No!
speaker: unspecified

utterance: No, don't go!
speaker: unspecified

utterance: Go to bed, and sleep until morning.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Welcome. Welcome to the Pirate's Cave ! The Red Rover of the North Fork of the Stanislaus River salutes the Queen of the Pirate Isle!
speaker: the leader

utterance: O, thank you very much, but could you would you please tell us what time it is ?
speaker: Polly

utterance: We are approaching the Middle of Next Week, but what of that ? Time is made for slaves ! The Red Rover seeks it not! Why should the Queen ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: I think we must be going.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Not until we have paid homage to your Majesty. What ho! there! Let Brother Step-and-Fetch-It pass the Queen around that we may do her honour;' Observing that Polly shrank slightly back, he added : Fear nothing, the man who hurts a hair of Her Majesty's head, dies by this hand. Ah ! ha !
speaker: the leader

utterance: Will Your Majesty see the Red Rover's dance ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: No, if you please.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Will Your Majesty fire this barrel of Gun powder, or tap this breaker of Grog ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: No, I thank you.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Is there no command Your Majesty would lay upon us ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: No, please.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Is there anything Your Majesty has lost ? Think again! Will Your Majesty deign to cast your royal eyes on this ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: If you please, Sir, it's Lady Mary's. She's lost it.
speaker: Polly

utterance: And lost it Your Majesty only to find some thing more precious ! Would Your Majesty hear the story ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: Enough. Bring refreshments. Will Your Majesty prefer winter-green, peppermint, rose, or accidulated drops ? Red or white ? Or perhaps Your Majesty will let me recommend these bull's eyes.
speaker: the leader

utterance: Why, it was a Dolly.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Your Majesty's head is level! Your Majesty has guessed it! It was Your Majesty's own dolly, Lady Mary, who broke the spell ! When Your Majesty came down the slide, the doll fell from your gracious hand when your foot slipped. Your Majesty recovered Lady Mary, but did not observe that her hair had caught in a peculiar rock, called the 'Outcrop,' and re mained behind ! When, later on, while sitting with your attendants at the mouth of the tunnel, Your Majesty discovered that Lady Mary's hair was gone ; I overheard Your Majesty, and despatched the trusty Step-and-Fetch-It to seek it at the mountain side. He did so, and found it clinging to the rock, and beneath it the entrance to the Secret Cave !
speaker: the leader

utterance: Melican man plenty foolee Melican chillern. No foolee China boy ! China boy knowee you. You no Led Lofer. You no Pilat you allee same tunnel man you Bob Johnson ! Me shabbee you! You dressee up allee same as Led Lofer but you Bob Johnson allee same. My fader washee washee for you. You no payee him. You owee him folty dolla ! Me blingee you billee. You no payee billee ! You say, ' Chalkee up, John.' You say, * Bimeby, John.' But me no catchee folty dolla !
speaker: Wan Lee

utterance: Ho ! ho ! A traitor ! Away with him to the deepest dungeon beneath the castle moat !
speaker: the leader

utterance: Don't you dare to touch him, if you do, I'll tell my father, and he will slay you! All of you there !
speaker: Polly

utterance: Your father ! Then you are not the Queen !
speaker: the leader

utterance: If you please, Sir, we're not always pirates, you know, and Wan Lee is only our boy what brushes my shoes in the morning, and runs of errands, and he doesn't mean anything bad, Sir, and we'd like to take him back home with us.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Enough. You shall go back together, and woe betide the miscreant who would prevent it. What say you brothers ? What shall be his fate who dares to separate our noble Queen from her faithful Chinese henchman ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: He shall die !
speaker: unspecified

utterance: And what say you shall we see them home ?
speaker: the leader

utterance: We will !
speaker: unspecified

utterance: It really seems too ridiculous for any thing, John, the idea of these grown men dressing them selves up to play with children.
speaker: Polly's mother

utterance: Ridiculous or not, these grown men of the ' Excelsior ' mine have just struck the famous old lode of Red Mountain, which is as good as a fortune to everybody on the Ridge, and were as wild as boys! And they say it never would have been found if Polly hadn't tumbled over the slide directly on top of the outcrop, and left the absurd wig of that wretched doll of hers to mark its site.
speaker: Polly's father

utterance: And that,'* murmured Polly sleepily to her doll as she drew it closer to her breast, is all that they know of it.
speaker: Polly
